creator: Robin.Harmsen@planet.nl
text:
When I enable IPv6 in Apache 2.0.48 by building it with Visual Studio .NET 2003
it keeps consuming 100% CPU, and I can't get a page loaded from it.

I only changed the apr.hw to enable IPv6 (#define APR_HAVE_IPV6 0 --> #define 
APR_HAVE_IPV6 1)

I tested it on Windows XP and Windows 2003, both give the same problem.

I know there are some fixes to make Apache 2.0.47 work . so I tried those 
fixes in Apache 2.0.48, and it seems to fix this bug. (these fixes are some 
changes in the source)

Maby it is a very good idea to include those fixes somehow into the original 
Apache source tree.

I got those fixes from http://win6.jp, I can supply the DIFF from the original 
2.0.47 Fixes if you like.

Created attachment 8926
Patch that seems to work
creator: Robin.Harmsen@planet.nl

Sorry, although the patch looks quite good, we cannot apply random patches
  unless they are submitted by the author themself, either to bugzilla or
  by email to the dev@httpd.apache.org list.  This is both for reasons of
  proper attribution, and copyright.

  The Apache license and copyright do not apply to patches or modules that 
  folks create for Apache software, until they are given to the foundation 
  directly by the author.

  Please encourage Jun-ya KATO to submit such a contributon in this bug report
  or the list.
